function.name: Absolute Value (ABS)
function.description: Returns the absolute value of the number. Essentialy converts all values to positive\r\nExample: ABS(load_sales.tax)

function.name: Ceiling (CEIL)
function.description: Returns the smallest integer or whole number that is greater than or equal to the value supplied\r\nExample: CEIL(load_sales.tax)

function.name: Cosine (COS)
function.description: Returns the trignometric cosine for an angle expressed in radians.\r\nExample: COS(load_sales.value)

function.name: Exponent (EXP)
function.description: Returns e raised to the specified power where e = 2.71828182845905.\r\nExample: EXP(3)

function.name: Floor (FLOOR)
function.description: Returns the smallest integer or whole number that is less than or equal to the value supplied\r\nExample: FLOOR(load_sales.tax)

function.name: Natural Logarithm (LN)
function.description: Returns the natural, or base 'e' logarithm of the supplied value\r\nExample: LN(10.34)

function.name: Base 10 Logarithm (LOG)
function.description: Returns the base10 logarithm of the supplied value\r\nExample: LOG(10,100)

function.name: Modulus (MOD)
function.description: Returns the remainder of a value divided by a divisor.\r\nExample: MOD(load_sales.boxes,4).

function.name: If Null Value (NVL)
function.description: Returns either the passed column or the default value if the passed column is null.\r\nExample: NVL(load_sales.boxes,0).

function.name: Raise to Exponent (POW)
function.description: Returns the value raised to the exponent.\r\nExample: POW(2,3) = 8

function.name: Round (ROUND)
function.description: Returns the value rounded to a given number of digits of precision.\r\nExample: ROUND(12.399,1) = 12.4

function.name: Sign (SIGN)
function.description: Returns either 0, 1, or -1 depending on the passed value. Zero if the passed vlaue is zero.\r\nExample: SIGN(load_sales.value)

function.name: Sine (SIN)
function.description: Returns the trignometric sine for an angle expressed in radians.\r\nExample: SIN(load_sales.value)

function.name: Square Root (SQRT)
function.description: Returns the square root of the value supplied.\r\nExample: SQRT(load_sales.value)

function.name: Tangent (TAN)
function.description: Returns the trignometric tangent for an angle expressed in radians.\r\nExample: TAN(load_sales.value)

function.name: Truncate (TRUNC)
function.description: Returns the value truncated to a given number of digits of precision.\r\nExample: TRUNC(12.399,1) = 12.3

function.name: ASCII value (ASCII)
function.description: Returns the ascii value of the first character in the string\r\nExample: ASCII(load_customer.name)

function.name: Character (CHR)
function.description: Returns a character whose ASCII value is the passed integer.\r\nExample: CHR(65)

function.name: If Null Value (NVL)
function.description: Returns either the passed column or the default value if the passed column is null.\r\nExample: NVL(load_sales.boxes,0).

function.name: Initial Capital (INITCAP)
function.description: Returns a string where the first letter of every word of a string column is converted to upper case.\r\nExample: INITCAP(load_customer.name)

function.name: Both Trim (BTRIM)
function.description: Returns a string where all occurrences of the specified characters are removed from both ends of the string.\r\nBy default white spaces are removed when removal characters are not specified.\r\nExample: BTRIM(load_customer.name,'+-=')

function.name: Length (LENGTH)
function.description: Returns an integer value containing the number of characters in the string column.\r\nExample: LENGTH(load_customer.name)

function.name: Locate (INSTR)
function.description: Returns an integer value containing the starting position of the search string, or zero if the search string is not found.\r\nExample: INSTR(load_customer.name,'smith',1,1)

function.name: Lower (LOWER)
function.description: Returns a string where every character in the passed column data is converted to lower case.\r\nExample: LOWER(load_customer.name)

function.name: Left Pad (LPAD)
function.description: Returns a string which is the passed column data padded to the left with either spaces or the set of characters provided.\r\nThe pad characters are added to achieve the length specified.\r\nExample: LPAD(load_customer.name,60,'.')

function.name: Left Trim (LTRIM)
function.description: Returns a string which is the passed column data where all of the leading characters specified have been removed.\r\nBy default white spaces are removed.\r\nExample: LTRIM(load_customer.name,'+-=')

function.name: Right Pad (RPAD)
function.description: Returns a string which is the passed column data padded to the right with either spaces or the set of characters provided.\r\nThe pad characters are added to achieve the length specified.\r\nExample: LPAD(load_customer.name,60,'.')

function.name: Right Trim (RTRIM)
function.description: Returns a string which is the passed column data where all of the trailing characters specified have been removed.\r\nBy default white spaces are removed.\r\nExample: RTRIM(load_customer.name,'+-=')

function.name: Sounds Like (NYSIIS)
function.description:
Used in a comparison situation. This function returns a sound code that can be used to compare against a second sound code.
Uses the New York State Identification and Intelligence System (NYSIIS) variation of Soundex.
Example: CASE WHEN NYSIIS(load_customer.last_name) = NYSIIS('smith') THEN 'smith'
ELSE load_customer.last_name END

function.name: Sub String (SUBSTR)
function.description: Returns a sub string of the passed column data. The start position and length of the substring are normally supplied.\r\nExample: SUBSTR(load_customer.name,INSTR(load_customer.name,' ')+1,10)

function.name: Translate (TRANSLATE)
function.description: Returns a string where characters have been replaced based on a positional matching of characters in the 'if' string\r\nwith characters in the 'then' string.\r\nExample: TRANSLATE(load_customer.name,'ABCDEFG','abcdefg')

function.name: Upper (UPPER)
function.description: Returns a string where every character in the passed column data is converted to upper case.\r\nExample: UPPER(load_customer.name)

function.name: Add Months (ADD_MONTHS)
function.description: Returns a date which has had the specified number of months added to it.\r\nExample: ADD_MONTHS(load_customer.start_date,36)

function.name: Last Day of Month (LAST_DAY)
function.description: Returns the date of the last day of the month that the supplied date is in.\r\nExample: LAST_DAY(load_sample.date1)

function.name: Months Diff. (MONTHS_BETWEEN)
function.description: Returns the number of months or part months between two dates.\r\nExample: MONTHS_BETWEEN(load_sample.date1,load_sample.date2)

function.name: Next Day (NEXT_DAY)
function.description: Returns the date of the next day (i.e. Monday, Tuesday...) after the supplied date.\r\nExample: NEXT_DAY(load_sample.date1,'Sunday')

function.name: System Datetime (CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
function.description: Returns the current system date and time.\r\nExample: CURRENT_TIMESTAMP

function.name: System Date (CURRENT_DATE)
function.description: Returns the current system date (without time).\r\nExample: CURRENT_DATE

function.name: Truncate Datetime (DATE_TRUNC)
function.description: Truncates a timestamp, date, or time to a specified precision of 'YEAR', 'MONTH’, 'DAY', 'HOUR', 'MINUTE', or 'SECOND'. \r\nExample to return the date truncated to the start of the day: Example: DATE_TRUNC('DAY',load_sample.date1)

function.name: Extract Datetime (EXTRACT)
function.description: Returns a numeric datetime or time component from a datetime or interval value.\r\nComponents are: epoch, year, quarter, month, week, day, dow, doy, hour, minute, second, millisecond, microsecond.\r\nExample: EXTRACT(DAY FROM TIMESTAMP '2013-12-25 14:00:00') returns 25.

function.name: Case Statement (CASE)
function.description: Allows the use of IF ... THEN ... ELSE logic.\r\nExample: CASE WHEN load_sample.temp1 > load_sample_temp2 THEN 'Hot' ELSE 'Cold' END
function.syntax: CASE [input_expression] WHEN when_expression THEN result_expression [ ...n ] [ ELSE else_result_expression] END
function.model: CASE [input_expression] WHEN when_expression THEN result_expression [ ...n ] [ ELSE else_result_expression] END

function.name: Decode (DECODE)
function.description: Returns the value that matches the specified criteria.\r\nExample: DECODE(load_sample.temp1,10,'Okay',9,'Cold',11,'Hot,'Unknown')

function.name: If Null Value (NVL)
function.description: Returns either the passed column or the default value if the passed column is null.\r\nExample: NVL(load_sales.boxes,0).

function.name: To Character (TO_CHAR)
function.description: Returns a string from either a number or date that is converted using the specified format mask.\r\nExample: TO_CHAR(load_inventory.date1,'YYYYMMDD')

function.name: To Number (TO_NUMBER)
function.description: Returns a number having converted from a character string.\r\nExample: TO_NUMBER(load_inventory.position)

function.name: To Date (TO_DATE)
function.description: Returns a date from a string that is converted using the specified format mask.\r\nExample: TO_DATE(load_inventory.date_ymd,'YYYYMMDD')

function.name: To Timestamp (TO_TIMESTAMP)
function.description: Returns a timestamp from a string that is converted using the specified format mask.\r\nExample: TO_TIMESTAMP(load_inventory.date_ymd,'YYYYMMDD')

function.name: Translate (TRANSLATE)
function.description: Returns a string where characters have been replaced based on a positional matching of characters in the 'if' string\r\nwith characters in the 'then' string.\r\nExample: TRANSLATE(load_customer.name,'ABCDEFG','abcdefg')

function.name: Cast as Type (CAST)
function.description: Returns the column converted to the specified data type and precision.\r\nExample: CAST(load_inventory.size AS VARCHAR(20))

function.name: Average (AVG)
function.description: Returns the average value for the supplied column.\r\nExample: AVG(load_inventory.temp1)

function.name: Count (COUNT)
function.description: Returns the count of the number of non null values for the column.\r\nExample: COUNT(load_inventory.temp1)

function.name: Maximum (MAX)
function.description: Returns the maximum value from the supplied column.\r\nExample: MAX(load_inventory.temp1)

function.name: Minimum (MIN)
function.description: Returns the minimum value from the supplied column.\r\nExample: MIN(load_inventory.temp1)

function.name: Standard Deviation (STDDEV)
function.description: Returns the standard deviation for the supplied column.\r\nExample: STDDEV(load_inventory.temp1)

function.name: Sum (SUM)
function.description: Returns the summed values from the supplied column.\r\nExample: SUM(load_inventory.temp1)

function.name: Variance (VARIANCE)
function.description: Returns the variance for the supplied column.\r\nExample: VARIANCE(load_inventory.temp1)
Inserts the plus operator to allow addition of two numbers.\r\nExample: load_sales.base + load_sales.gst
Inserts the minus operator to allow subtraction of two numbers.\r\nExample: load_sales.base - load_sales.gst
Inserts the divide operator to allow division of two numbers.\r\nExample: load_sales.base / load_sales.gst
Inserts the multiply operator to allow multiplication of two numbers.\r\nExample: load_sales.base * load_sales.gst
Inserts the concatenation operator to combine two strings.\r\nExample: load_customer.first_name || ' ' || load_customer.last_name
Inserts the space character for clarity or other purposes.
Inserts the open bracket, used for setting precedence in result evaluation.
Inserts the close bracket, used for setting precedence in result evaluation.
